newsitem.title: GERMANY: German police detain man in church arson case.
newsitem.headline: German police detain man in church arson case.

text.p: Police on Tuesday said they had detained a 44-year-old man in connection with an arson attack on a church at the weekend, the third blaze in a German church in as many weeks.

Police had said they were not ruling out that right-wing extremists could be behind the fire, which completely destroyed the wooden altar of the church in the northern town of Husum early on Sunday, after they found a note on the church door which they said was both anti-Semitic and anti-Christian.
They said the man was detained north of Hamburg after witnesses noted down the registration number of his car, which had been parked outside the church at the weekend.
A 19-year old man was detained at the weekend after confessing to another arson attack which destroyed a Roman Catholic church in the northern German town of Luebeck three weeks ago.
Firefighters found five swastikas sprayed in white paint on the building alongside the name of a local priest who was campaigning to stop Algerian asylum-seekers from being deported.
On June 4, a protestant church in Hamburg was set on fire after being daubed with right-wing and Satanic symbols but the building was only slightly damaged.
